titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the House of Representatives on the occasion of the twenty-fifth anniversary of the independence of Jamaica.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
House Committee on Foreign Affairs Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Resolution Agreed to in House (Amended) by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 8/4/1987--Introduced. States that the House of Representatives: (1) expresses its congratulations to the Government and people of Jamaica on their 25th anniversary of independence; (2) declares that economic and social development in Jamaica are important for the stability of the entire Caribbean region as well as the interests of the United States; and (3) expresses its sense that the United States should continue to support Jamaican efforts in developing Jamaica's economy through free market principles and in furthering cooperation in peace, economic development, and security in the Caribbean region.
